  "Allegations" : "CLIENT ALLEGES SECURITIES BCX AND INDUSTRIAL INCOME TRUST DID NOT FIT HER RISK TOLERANCE AND WERE NOT SUITABLE FOR HER ACCOUNT.",

  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE CLIENT ACCOUNT WAS SET UP ON 72T.   IT WAS DESIGNED FOR INCOME TO KEEP UP WITH 72T DISTRIBUTIONS AND SOME GROWTH THROUGH EQUITY DIVIDEND FUNDS, ETC.    WE AGREED TO INVEST IN THE INDUSTRIAL INCOME TRUST FOR TWO REASONS; REAL ESTATE FOR DIVERSIFICATION TO HER PORTFOLIO AND AN ALTERNATIVE INCOME IN A ZERO INTEREST RATE ENVIRONMENT.  THE CLIENT SIGNED ALL THE PAPERWORK AND THE INVESTMENT HAS DONE WELL.   AS PART OF OUR OVERALL INVESTMENT STRATEGY: REAL ESTATE, COMMODITIES, STOCKS (FIRST TRUST), BONDS, AND CLOSED-END FUND DIVERSIFIED GROWTH STRATEGIES; COMMODITIES WERE A GOOD FIT FOR A PORTION OF THE CLIENT'S PORTFOLIO.  THE COMMODITIES, AS AN ASSET CLASS HAS NOT PERFORMED AS WELL AS THE OTHER ASSET CLASSES; HOWEVER THE FUND USED (BCX)HAS GENERATED ANOTHER ALTERNATIVE SOURCE OF INCOME TO MEET THE DISTRIBUTION NEEDS OF THE CLIENT.    THE CLIENT ALSO HAD EQUITY INVESTMENTS THAT HAD DONE VERY WELL.  OVERALL, THE CLIENT HAD A DIVERSIFIED PORTFOLIO THAT WAS CONSISTENT WITH HER RISK TOLERANCE AND INCOME/GROWTH STRATEGY."
}
